VLIB_bhattacharyaDistance_F32

Detailed Description


Functions

void VLIB_bhattacharyaDistance_F32 (const VLIB_F32 *restrict X, const VLIB_F32 *restrict Y, uint32_t N, VLIB_F32 *D)

Function Documentation

void VLIB_bhattacharyaDistance_F32 ( const VLIB_F32 *restrict  X,
const VLIB_F32 *restrict  Y,
uint32_t  N,
VLIB_F32 *  D 
)

Description
This function accepts as input two arrays, p and q, of size N containing the discrete probability distributions. It returns the Bhattacharya distance, B, between p and q as a 32-bit floating point value as defined in the following equation: 
     B = sqrt(1- SUM((sqrt(p(i)*q(i))))) , for all 0 < i < N ,SUM stands for summation.
Parameters:
[in] *X Pointer to array containing first probability distribution
[in] *Y Pointer to array containing second probability distribution
[in] N Number of elements in the probability distributions (UQ32.0)
[out] *D Pointer to variable to store the computed Bhattacharya Distance
Assumptions
  • All arrays should be double-word aligned.
  • Bhattacharya distance is defined on probability distribution functions. This implies that the elements in X and Y should sum to 1, respectively.
  • There should be a minimum of four elements in X and Y.
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
